edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public abstract class Character
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a character in the game. This class will implement the Serializable class. The Character object will be given a row position, column position, and a status of whether it is alive or not. There are two types of characters that are in the game: the player and the enemies.
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • positionRow

        private int positionRow
        This field represents the row position in the grid for the Character.

      • positionColumn

        private int positionColumn
        This field represents the column position in the grid for the Character.

      • alive

        private boolean alive
        This field determines whether the Character is alive or not. True would make the Character alive, while false would mean they are not alive.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(int row,
                 int column)
        The constructor for the Character class. The constructor will take in a row and column, to be able to place the character onto the grid. The constructor also sets the person to be alive, meaning the character is on the grid.
        Parameters:
        row - the position of the Character on the grid, in terms of which row.
        column - the position of the Character on the grid, in terms of which column.

    • Method Detail

      • getPositionRow

      • setPositionRow

        public void setPositionRow(int row)
        This method will be used to set the row position of the Character to what is put for the parameter.
        Parameters:
        row - the row position that is to be given to the Character object.

      • setPositionColumn

        public void setPositionColumn(int column)
        This method will be used to set the column position of the Character to what is put for the parameter.
        Parameters:
        column - the column position that is to be given to the Character object.

        public boolean isAlive()
        This method will be used to return whether the Character is alive or not.

        This method will move the Character to the right one space in the grid.

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        This method will move the Character to the left one space in the grid.

      • die

        public void die()
        This method is called when the Character dies, specifically the ninja. The Character is moved off the grid and is the boolean alive is set to false.
